Node: Float64ToHeapNumberForField

Defined: src/maglev/maglev-ir.h class Float64ToHeapNumberForField : public FixedInputValueNodeT<1, Float64ToHeapNumberForField>

Usage: Created in maglev-graph-builder.cc in BuildStoreField when field_representation.IsDouble() and access_info.HasTransitionMap(). The builder emits AddNewNode<Float64ToHeapNumberForField>({value}) to allocate a new HeapNumber for the field.

Properties:
- InputTypes: HoleyFloat64
- OpProperties: NotIdempotent, CanAllocate, DeferredCall (conversion node that forces allocation)
- GenerateCode and SetValueLocationConstraints implemented in maglev-ir.cc (GenerateCode will allocate a HeapNumber and return its reference; used specifically for field transitions where a new mutable HeapNumber is needed)

Where it's interesting: This node implements "AllocateMutableHeapNumber" semantics when storing a double into a field whose representation requires a boxed HeapNumber (transition). It is distinct from Float64ToTagged (which can canonicalize to Smi or HeapNumber) since it forces allocation for field ownership.

FileLine: maglev/maglev-ir.h:4371-4378, maglev/maglev-ir.cc:5282-5294
explanation: Float64ToHeapNumberForField is the IR allocation node for creating a mutable HeapNumber specifically to own a field's double value. The graph builder adds it whenever a double store requires a transition_map allocation; otherwise Maglev uses StoreFloat64 to update an existing HeapNumber.value_ in-place.
